intro: Nonea stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf nonea, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in mountainous regions. Nonea stenophylla is adapted to arid environments, with deep roots that help it access moisture from deeper soil layers.
